snippet: New York’s top banking regulator had accused Standard Chartered of laundering $250 billion for Iranian clients and lying about it to authorities.
abstract: British bank Standard Chartered agrees to pay the New York Department of Financial Services $340 million to settle claims that it laundered $250 billion in tainted money for Iranian clients and lied to regulators; agreement is a victory for Benjamin M Lawsky and his 10-month old agency, which took on the bank alone.
lead_paragraph: New York’s top banking regulator had accused Standard Chartered of laundering $250 billion for Iranian clients and lying about it to authorities.

headline.seo: Standard Chartered Settles Iran Inquiry for $340 Million
headline.main: British Bank in $340 Million Settlement for Laundering
headline.print_headline: Laundering Case Settled by Bank For $340 Million
